reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed six nights at the Astrid while seeing Rome sights. We flew in to Fiumicino where we had arranged a car service that took us straight to the hotel. It took about a half an hour in a late night traffic. On our way back we used tram-metro-train combination which worked just find with not a lot walking required.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Astrid is three tram stops from Piazza del Popolo in a quiet residential neighborhood. The distance is definitely within walking distance but the heat may direct you to use tram. Within a block there are several restaurants that do not have a touristy feeling meaning the food is good, moderately priced served with friendly service. Also the small grocery store on your way to tram stop has very attractive prices for instance for water bottles.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: The room was decent in size, two people could open their luggage without too much problems. Air conditioning has controls in the room and is very efficient. Our room had a view of the Tiber river.
reviews.title: a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: In the rooms there are is a free minibar with soda, water and juice. Also free wireless internet connection is available by asking for username and password from front desk.
reviews.title: Group of 15 great stay

likes.disliked: — Must take transport to central Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff all around was very helpful and especially the cleaning service was of very high standard. The included breakfast is served on a very nice terrace and consists of pastries, bread, cereal, yogurt, juice and coffee/tea. The staff makes a very nice cappuccino on request.
reviews.title: Helpful, friendly staff

likes.disliked: — not really within walking distance of centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff amazing, Great gem right along the Tiber River, so you can't get lost!! The 5th floor - Breakfast room and great views of the Tiber and St. Peters Dome. A short walk to public transit!
reviews.title: Staff and Service Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here's something that does not happen at the majority of hotels. We had booked an all day trip to the Isle of Capri and were being picked up at the hotel at 6:30 am. We were going to miss breakfast. As we were standing outside waiting for our bus the gentleman at the front desk comes out to us with a breakfast to go!!
reviews.title: All that you need for a weekend away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room small but no issue with that! Beautiful location, Roof Top Terrace was great used it every moring for breakfast - except one and at night to sit outside and watch Rome go by! We walked from St Peters back one day - great walk!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently took my girlfriend away for valentines weekend and used TripAdvisor to help me decide which hotel to stay in, therefore I felt it only fair that I write a review of my own personal experience for others to make any potential decisions upon.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The weather was really good for mid February, it was a bit chilly, still need for a thick jumper but when the sun shines it's absolutely fine, and it did shine for pretty much the entire of the weekend.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel on outskirts of city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrific hotel! The staff was super friendly and made the stay very enjoyable. The rooms were plenty spacious for my wife and I and the minibar’s daily replenishment at no cost was a huge treat! We stayed in August and room temperature was very comfortable. Make sure you make it up to the breakfast in the morning…it’s a delicious way to start your day!
reviews.title: A great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only tip…we had read here on tripadvisor that you take the Metro to Flaminio stop and then the #2 tram for 3 stops. That is correct with the exception of the tram info. It appears the #2 tram is currently undergoing some rehabilitation so you must take the #2 bus instead of the tram. Small detail but may save you some trouble during the tram rehab.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009
reviews.text: Can’t say enough good about this hotel. We hope to visit again soon!
reviews.title: Air conditioning or large bed..cant have both apparently

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Astrid from June 5th-9th,2009. Upon our check in, we received room on the 5th floor which was a large room with a great view. The only problem was the air conditioning. Therefore, we went to the reception where they tried to get the AC going but no luck. Therefore, they put us in a smaller room facing the courtyard, again no AC. Apparently, AC was not working in any unit on the 5th floor. We went back to reception and ended up with an excellent room on the 4th floor with an awesome view on St Peter's Basilica. We enjoyed our stay from there on. Here are some pros & cons of Hotel Astrid:
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, small room but new and very clean. Receptionist and others workers arenot nice as u can expect, they alway look at u are disturbing them. Breakfast is very low, salty food are few and they do not replace it when needed, some croissant and bread. Minibar was included in my room rate (1 coke, 1 fanta, 1 fruit juice and 4 bottle of water every day) The worst thing is the parking. Do NOT USE IT!!!! let me explain: they do not have their own parking the use another one closed to the hotel (50 meters). IF you drive a big car is a problem, If you dont know exacly when you are going to use your car is a problem. IF you try to take your car at 1230 am - the parking close at 1 am- you can find the parking already closed.... last but not least IF you leave the hotel on sunday remember you have to take out the car before 10 am because the parking close at that time. so you have the room checkout at 12 but the car should leave before you..... crazy! for that kind of service you pay 40 euros a day (if you go direcly there is around 15-20)
reviews.title: Nice place with some spots

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The building is grand. The rooms are a bit small. The breakfast room has a perfect view over the Rome houseroffs towards the San Pietro. Good service. Somewhat away from the centre, but metro and tram bring you closeby. Quit and safe area.
reviews.title: Perfect views from the breakfast room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My stay in Astrid hotel was for business. I liked so much the business service they offer, Internet connection, news, renting car, etc..
reviews.title: Nice view on the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in a residential area near the center, in front of the Tevere river .
reviews.title: Very big hotel, but very "well-managed"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's inside a big palace. I appreciated so much the terrace on the top. How can you forget a similar view??? Yes I reccomend this hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!!
